column4: What do I have to add to my /etc/apt/mirror.list to make my local apt-mirror so I can *install* from it and not just *update*?
you install from /etc/apt/sources.list and you mirror other repos from /etc/apt/mirror.list
apt-mirrir is reading the mirror-file, apt-get is reading the sources.list
right. My client is booting from PXE into the Ubuntu installer, which works, but if I tell it to install from my local repository, it says the necessary files aren't there.
the local repo is a big place :-) where should it be relative to mirror/archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu?
in the branche, e.g. maverick/i386 also "all" and "amd64" have there own Packages.gz
yes, there are Packages.gz files there.
apt-get update and apt-get upgrade work fine on all my local clients. Installing fails. Lemme go get the exact error message...
if installing fails, sound like the Packages.gz is out of sync with the packages the repo contains
